metadata.title: How to Use YouTube Analytics 2025: Complete Data Guide
metadata.description: Master YouTube Analytics to grow your channel. Understand metrics, find insights, and make data-driven decisions.

hero.headline: How to Use YouTube Analytics to Grow Your Channel
hero.subheadline: Turn data into decisions with a complete understanding of YouTube Analytics.

sections.content: YouTube Analytics tells the story of your channel's performance. Understanding these metrics helps you make better content decisions, double down on what works, and fix what doesn't. This guide explains every important metric and how to use them for growth.

content.title: Reach
content.description: Impressions, CTR, and traffic sources. How people discover your content.

content.title: Engagement
content.description: Watch time, average view duration, and retention. How people consume your content.

content.title: Audience
content.description: Who watches, when they watch, and subscriber behavior. Who your viewers are.

sections.title: Essential Metrics to Track
content: Watch time: Total minutes watched (most important)
Average view duration: How long people watch
Impressions: How often you appear in feeds
Retention graphs: Where viewers drop off
Traffic sources: How viewers find you

sections.title: Actionable Insights to Find
content: What content your audience watches longest
How new vs returning viewers behave

sections.title: Weekly Analytics Review
content: Check recent video performance vs average
Review retention graphs for new uploads
Check real-time for current video performance

faq.question: What's more important: views or watch time?
faq.answer: Watch time. YouTube prioritizes videos that keep people watching. High view count with low watch time signals poor content. Aim for both, prioritize watch time.

faq.question: How often should I check analytics?
faq.answer: Weekly for most creators. Daily for new uploads. Don't obsess over hourly fluctuations. Look for patterns over time, not single data points.

faq.question: What's a good click-through rate?
faq.answer: 4-10% is typical. Higher is better but varies by content type and traffic source. Compare your CTR to your own average, not others.

faq.question: Why do my impressions fluctuate?
faq.answer: YouTube tests content with audiences. Low early engagement means fewer impressions. Strong performance expands reach. It's normal and algorithmic.
